Assuming that the data for the N= 231 firms constitute a random sample from 
a 4 variate normal distribution, test  the hypothesis that ð’–ðŸŽ = (20, 7.5, 10, 2) 

```{r}
s_upper_tri = matrix(c(0.260, 0.080, 1.639, 0.156, 0, 1.513, -0.222, -0.019, 0, 0, 26.626, 2.233, 0, 0, 0, 1.346), ncol = 4, nrow = 4, byrow = TRUE)
    
s_matrix = s_upper_tri + t(s_upper_tri) - diag(diag(s_upper_tri))
print("The given Variance-Covariance matrix is")
print(s_matrix)

N = 231
P = 4                   

sample_mean = c(20.92, 8.06, 11.78, 1.09)
null_pop_mean = c(20, 7.5, 10, 2)

hotelling_t1 = N*t(sample_mean - null_pop_mean) %*% solve(s_matrix) %*% (sample_mean - null_pop_mean)
hotelling_t1

t_cal = ((N-P)*hotelling_t1)/(P*(N-1))
t_cal 
t_tab = qf(1-0.05, P, (N-P))
t_tab

if (t_cal > t_tab) {
  print("We reject the null hypothesis at 5% level of Significance")
} else {
  print("We do not have enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis at 5% level of Significance")}
```
